text:
Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
A NEW LOOK FOR THE LANESBOROUGH IN LONDON
The Lanesborough in the Knightsbridge neighborhood in London was one of the city’s top luxury hotels when it closed its doors in December 2013 for a renovation. Now, following a nearly $100 million makeover, it will reopen on July 15 for overnight guests. The refurbishment sticks to the elegant Regency-style décor the 93-room property has been known for since it opened in 1991, and was led by Alberto Pinto, the well-regarded interior design studio.
Guest rooms have new period-style wood furniture and silk fabrics but also emphasize technology, according to the managing director, Geoffrey Gelardi. “We wanted to stick to our original aesthetic but also want to feel modern,” he said.
